Cross-connection in the potable water supply system observed in that a gooseneck hose was extending down and reaching the bottom of the middle sink of a 3-compartment sink at the kitchen. The gooseneck hose was observed connected to a faucet which was connected to a potable water line. No backflow prevention device was observed on the potable water line connected to the gooseneck hose. The middle sink was observed with stagnant water and dishes and cooking pans with old food residue. Corrective action: Cross connection was disconnected by removing the gooseneck hose out of the sink and placed above the flood level of the sink restoring the air gap. NYCHC 81.20(a)

Enclosed service area not provided for the cleaning and servicing of mobile food units in that pushcarts were observed washing in pushcart storage area and the floor observed flooded with dirty water while service room observed dry and no pushcart observed to be clean there.. NYCHC 89.27 (c)

Evidence of mouse activity present in that 196 fresh mice excreta observed in the following locations: 66 observed on the electrical box in the basement food storage area, 50 observed along the wall and flood junction under the electrical box in the basement food storage area, 17 observed on electric meter box in the basement food storage area, 16 observed along the wall and floor junction under wooden food storage stands in the basement food storage area, 27 observed on the floor along the wall and floor junction behind gas water heater in the basement food storage area, 12 observed on the floor behind bike storage in the basement food storage area, and 8 observed on the floor behind non-functioning freezer-top 1-door reach-in refrigerator in the basement food storage area. Corrective action: PIC instructed to implement proper pest control measures. Remove harborage conditions such as standing water, close all entry ways and holes, store food in vermin proof containers, eliminate bree

Evidence of mouse activity present in that 59 fresh mice excreta were observed in the following areas: 6 observed on flood under food storage shelves in basement rear food storage room; 8 observed on floor under equipment storage shelves in basement equipment storage room; 18 observed under food prep table and 13 observed on floor next to door to backyard in basement kitchen; 8 observed on floor next to door to backyard in first floor kitchen; and 6 observed behind trash bin in customer seating area  . Corrective action: PIC instructed to implement proper pest control measures.  Remove harborage conditions such as standing water, close all entry ways and holes, store food in vermin proof containers, eliminate breeding conditions and improve overall sanitary conditions.NYCHC 81.23(a)
Facility conditions conducive to the existence of pest life observed in that floor was very wet/flooded in food storage/prep area. NYCHC 81.23(a)

Facility conditions conducive to the existence of pest life observed in that open rear door which was leading to backyard, observed in kitchen. Old food particles observed at the opening of pipe which comes from wok stove and in funnel below said pipe in kitchen. Old flood particles observed in funnel under 3-compartment sink in kitchen.. NYCHC 81.23(a)
Flooring improperly constructed or maintained in that cement/concrete floor observed severely flooded in carts & food storage area. NYCHC 81.21(e)
Flooring improperly constructed or maintained in that main bowl cart storage area, walk-in-refrigerator and food prep area / administrative desk triage floor observed everely flooded . NYCHC 81.21(e)

Flooring improperly constructed or maintained in that tiled floor observed covered with absorbent cardboard in front of deep fryer in kitchen. 15 Dead roaches observed on cement floor in the following areas: 6 in flood storage area and 9 in gas hot water heater room in basement. One of the heaters in said room belonged to establishment, as per operator. NYCHC 81.17(e) (1)

Food, food preparation area, food storage area or area(s) used by employees or patrons contaminated by sewage or liquid in that backed up flood water from clogged floor and underground drains was observed contaminating in the basement dry food, beer and wine storage area. Corrective action: Reason for sewage failure was corrected.  Contaminated area was washed, rinsed and sanitized. NYCHC 81.20(b)

Food, food preparation area, food storage area or area(s) used by employees or patrons contaminated by sewage or liquid waste in that murky, gray waste water that is coming from the floor drain in the employee restroom was observed contaminating the kitchen by the waste water flooding onto the kitchen floor and spreading to be approximately 1/4 inch deep 12 feet in length and 5 feet in width, thus contaminating the area where employees prepare food for customer consumption. Corrective action: Instructed operator to contact a licensed plumber and a professional cleaning service. NYCHC 81.20(b)

Food, food preparation area, food storage area or area(s) used by employees or patrons contaminated by sewage or liquid waste in that standing liquid waste from the grease trap was observed contaminating the entired basement where food and paper good storage are located. As per operator said the rain from the day prior inspection was causing the water back up from the grease trap onto the floor flooding the basement. Corrective action: Reason for sewage failure was corrected.  Contaminated area was washed, rinsed and sanitized. NYCHC 81.20(b)

Food, food preparation area, food storage area or area(s) used by employees or patrons contaminated by sewage or liquid waste in that white, cloudy water from the sewage line was observed contaminating the basement.  The white cloudy water was observed underneath wood panel flooring in the basement, where tables and beverages are stored.  The water also was observed coming from a sewage flood pit that contained approximately 2 feet of pink, gray and white sewage water with items floating inside of pool.  When food worker went upstairs to flush the toilet from the mens room, a surge of sewage water surged toward the reach-down and walk-in freezers. Corrective action: Food service establishment closed by Order of the Department of Health and Mental Hygiene because sewage-contaminated area could not be properly cleaned. NYCHC 81.20(b)

Food not protected at all times from potential sources of contamination in that 1 cardboard box (approximately 5 pounds) of Blue moon beer, and 1 cardboard box (approximately 5 pounds) of Sweet Amigo Sangria wine were observed stored directly on dirty floor in front storage area in basement. Said boxes were observed with watermarks from liquid waste flooding at the time of inspection. NYCHC 81.07(d)

Food not protected at all times from potential sources of contamination in that approximately 200 pounds of ice for customer beverages noted being held in basement storage hallway area which was observed with a sewage leak/flood contaminating area.  Approximately 20 pounds of raw whole cabbage    was observed being chopped in basement prep area which was observed with a sewage leak contaminating the area in basement prep area.  Walk-in refrigerator and walk-in freezer observed with assorted food items for customer service noted in basement storage area which was noted with a sewage leak/flood   . NYCHC 81.07(d)

Food preparation area, food storage area or other area used by employees or patrons contaminated by sewage or liquid waste in that clear rainwater in the entire basement floor (approximately 3 inch depth) leaking from roof was observed contaminating entire floor. Said area was flooded 20 minutes prior to inspection, as per FPC holder MUSHTAG BALMACOON. Contaminating water observed all over the floor throughout the basement employee's restroom, single service storage area, ice machine, liquor storage room that clearly contaminating the FSE.  Corrective action: Reason for sewage failure was corrected. Operator instructed to get a professional cleaning to wash, rinse, and sanitize the contaminated area. NYCHC 81.20(b)

Food preparation area, food storage area or other area used by employees or patrons contaminated by sewage or liquid waste in that liquid sewage water leaking profusely from the ceiling above the delivery staircase leading to the outside was observed contaminating the food storage area in the basement. liquid waste was observed flooding the floor of the food/paper goods storage area containing single use items for customer use and an assortment of condiments. Walk-in refrigerator is also located in the basement approximately 20 feet away from where the leakage is occurring. Corrective action: Operator closed down the FSE and called a licensed plumber. NYCHC 81.20(b)

Handwash facility inadequate in that front food  prep area, kitchen food prep area and employees' unisex restroom hand wash sink observed without hot and cold running water, during inspection. The main water supply was pulled out by operator which resulted to excessive flooding inside FSE and main water supply valve was shut off by operator. NYCHC 81.21(b)

Handwash facility inadequate in that kitchen and front service prep area hand wash sink observed without, hot running water. Hot water heater located in basement of next door Chinese restaurant was turned off, due to a flood caused by a leaking water pipe. Said heater was turned back on by the superintendent, and hot water was restored. NYCHC 81.29(c)

Liquid waste not carried to sewer or sewage disposal system so as to prevent contamination of the premises and its contents in that clear odorless liquid waste was observed gushing/leaking out of an approximately 1 inch in diameter hole in the wall behind the water heaters in the basement. Food establishment basement floor was observed flooded and contaminated by approximately 2-3 inches deep of said clear odorless liquid waste at the time of inspection. NYCHC 81.20(b)

Liquid waste not carried to sewer or sewage disposal system so as to prevent contamination of the premises and its contents in that high-temperature dishwasher in the kitchen observed leaking water when in operation. Said high-temperature dishwasher had been put through 3 cycles prior to flooding nearly the entire kitchen floor with water in excess of approximately 6 feet in diameter. NYCHC 81.20(b)

Liquid waste not carried to sewer or sewage disposal system so as to prevent contamination of the premises and its contents in that indirect waste pipe observed extending directly down into funnel drain on flood preparation sink in front service area of Bubble tea section without an air break in that gold waste pipe extends in to funnel drain on floor. As per operator 1 of the 2 sinks is used to rinse tapicoa balls and other foods directly in sink. This connection does not drain into a slop sink. NYCHC 81.20(b)

Liquid waste not carried to sewer or sewage disposal system so as to prevent contamination of the premises and its contents in that pipe from indirect waste line, observed overflowing and draining liquid waste water directly onto floor below only handwash sink in front pizza preparation area/service area. At the time of inspection, whenever food worker washes hands in said only handwash sink, the indirect drain observed overfilled with water and said liquid waste will overflow the funnel, flooding all over the floor below handwash sink. Said liquid waste is approximately 20 inches in diameter at the time of inspection. Manager cannot correct said violation at the time of inspection. Corrective action: Manager informed to have a license plumber fix said violation in the future. NYCHC 81.20(b)

Liquid waste not carried to sewer or sewage disposal system so as to prevent contamination of the premises and its contents in that waste line observed back up and waste water flooding the floor  in  food prep/service area area .  NYCHC 81.20(b)

Liquid waste not carried to sewer or sewage disposal system so as to prevent contamination of the premises and its contents in that waste lines from hanwash sink and single compartment culinary sink at front prep/service area observed draining into a clogged floor drain flooding over to the floor at front prep/service area. Said floor drain was snaked to resume the flow of the waste water to the sewer .  NYCHC 81.20(b)

Mouse activity present in that approximately 25 fresh mice excreta observed as follows: approximately 10 on shelf under cutting board storage rack in kitchen, approximately 10 on flood behind reach-in freezer in basement, 5 on floor under liquor shelf in basement office. Corrective action: Operator instructed to implement proper pest control measures by removing harborage conditions, such as standing water, closing all entry ways and holes, storing food in vermin proof containers, eliminating breeding conditions, improve overall sanitary conditions, and provide proper extermination, if necessary.  All contaminated area and equipment are to be washed, rinsed, and sanitized..NYCHC 81.23(a)

Mouse activity present in that approximately 27 fresh mice excreta observed in food service establishment in the following areas:  approximately 10 mice excreta observed on floor and on top of tile ledge under beverage storage rack in basement  next to staircase, approximately 10 mice excreta observed on filter (ventilation hood) on floor next to beverage storage rack in basement next to staircase,  5 mice excreta observed on flood under desk in basement office, 2 mice excreta observed on floor in gas hot water heater/tools storage room in basement . . Corrective action: Operator instructed to implement proper pest control measures by removing harborage conditions, such as standing water, closing all entry ways and holes, storing food in vermin proof containers, eliminating breeding conditions, improve overall sanitary conditions, and provide proper extermination, if necessary.  All contaminated area and equipment are to be washed, rinsed, and sanitized..NYCHC 81.23(a)

Potentially hazardous cold food, other than processed fish, not held at or below 41ï¿½F  (5ï¿½C) in that approximately 30 gallons of Rollin Dairy  whole milk  registered at 57ï¿½F in the 8 door slide reach in refrigerator in the front food service  area. Food has been ion said unit for 5  hours, as per operator's statement. Said refrigeration unit not functioning properly and holding potentially hazardous foods at an ambient temperature of 58ï¿½F. Said unit was noted flooded with approximately 1/4 inches of condenstate water. Corrective action: Food was rendered inedible and discarded by food worker.  NYCHC 81.09(a)

Premises not free from harmful vapor or noxious gas that may endanger the life or health of employees and other persons in that carbon monoxide gas detected at 301 ppm from gas boilers and gas water heater in boiler room in basement storage area. Corrective action: Area ventilated and unit shut down and tagged as defective and dangerous and NY Fire Department notified (Chief Flood of 21 Battalion  and Lieutenant  Barr from Ladder 78 responded and had a Carbon Monoxide reading of 200ppm in gas boiler/water heater room in basement storage area.  NYCHC 81.19(c )

Sewage disposal system improperly constructed or operated in that raw liquid waste water observed backing up and dripping onto basement floor from indirect drain under three compartment sink (1 compartment used for hand wash) in bar area. Approximately 1'' flooded water observed on floor next to walk in keg refrigerator in basement food & dry goods storage area. Corrective action: Reason for sewage failure was corrected. Sewage disposal system improperly constructed or operated in that raw sewage/dirty waste water observed bubbling up/spewing from floor drain in basement food storage area at time of inspection. Said basement was observed completely flooded by approximately 6 inches in depth of dirty waste water. Walk-in refrigerator filled with food items observed flooded by approximately 6 inches in depth of waste water at time of inspection. Said basement was flooded one day prior to inspection, as per operator statement. Operator observed pumping water from basement to sidewalk at time of inspection. Establishment observed with customers eating on first floor, and food items from basement were observed being transported from flooded basement to first floor kitchen at time of inspection. As per operator statement, main building waste pipe broke or clogged up yesterday, thus flooding basement of said establishment and adjacent deli sharing same building.. Corrective action: Food service establishment

Sewage disposal system improperly constructed or operated in that raw sewage observed in food storage area in basement. Said basementis 90% flooded with liquid waste more than 2 to 4-inch deep. Toilet facilities completely flooded with more than4-inch deep f waste water making them inaccessible to food workers and patrons, at trime of inspection. Corrective action: Food service establishment closed by Order of the Department of Health and Mental Hygiene because reason for sewage failure was not corrected. NYCHC 81.20(b) and (c )

Sewage disposal system not provided, improperly constructed or not operating adequately in that a backup of sewage water was observed rising from the floor drains & onto the tiled floor in the food preparation/service area. The floor drains were observed flooding after the toilet flushometer in the employee's unisex restroom was depressed three times. Said water also observed leaking continously from ceiling in rear area and utility hot water heater room in basement at time of inspection. Sewage disposal system not provided, improperly constructed or not operating adequately in that liquid waste observed standing approximately 6 inches deep  in basement. Entire basement was observed flooded making access to employee bathroom and dish washing sinks impossible. Corrective action: Unable to determine cause of sewage issue and operator instructed to call plumber and wash rinse and sanitize basement. NYCHC 81.20(b)

Sewage/liquid waste not carried to sewer or sewage disposal system in that waste observed contaminating area frequented by employees. The whole area in front basement was observed flooded with water of unknown origin. Foodworkers were observed crossing said flooded area to get to their changing area and to use employee restroom in basement. No food was observed being stored/prepared in said area. No smell of sewage observed. As per operator, unknown pipe broke and leaked said water, whichwas observed covering area 6'x12' and 2-3'' deep. Operator was observed using portable pump to remove said leak. Corrective action: No new incoming water was observed. Reason for sewage failure was corrected.  Contaminated area was washed, rinsed and sanitized. NYCHC 81.20(b)

Sewage/liquid waste not carried to sewer or sewage disposal system in that waste observed contaminating basement kitchen. As per owner, this is the third time in the past month that basement has been flooded. Waste water is approximately 1 foot deep from staircase throughout lower level of kitchen. Foods on upper level in kitchen are inaccessible to food workers. Waste water cannot be removed at this time, in that, water is still coming out of the drain. As per owner,  establishment has been operating since 11am; the flood began approximately 30 minutes prior to the start of inspection. Corrective action: All contaminated food was removed from the area.  Contaminated food was rendered inedible and discarded.  Contaminated area was washed, rinsed and sanitized. NYCHC 81.20(b)

Sewage/liquid waste not carried to sewer or sewage disposal system in that waste observed contaminating kitchen floor from an overflowing drain under dishwasher (waste water observed white and with debris no odor detected) said water drained down to basement creating a flood approximately 2 inches high in the area of hot water heater. Corrective action: Plumber is on the way and has not reached location yet as per operator (maybe 15 to 20 minutes) . NYCHC 81.20(b)

Food, food preparation area, food storage area or area(s) used by employees or patrons contaminated by sewage or liquid in that backed up flood water from clogged floor and underground drains was observed contaminating in the basement dry food, beer and wine storage area. Food, food preparation area, food storage area or area(s) used by employees or patrons contaminated by sewage or liquid waste in that cloudy, light brown colored sewage with fecal matter observed coming out of sewage pipe in floor and over flooding (approximately 10 inches thick) near paper goods storage shelves/ employee seating area in basement. Food worker was observed contaminating kitchen tiled floor by going to basement sewage area and coming back to first floor kitchen to prepare foods for customer consumption with same shoes . Corrective action: Food service establishment closed by Order of the Department of Health and Mental Hygiene because reason for sewage failure was not corrected. NYCHC 81.20(b)

Food, food preparation area, food storage area or area(s) used by employees or patrons contaminated by sewage or liquid waste in that cloudy water waterof unknown origin observed actively flowing from the ceiling in and out walk-in keg refrigerator, flooding the unit and the rest of the basement with an extending waste. Corrective action: Food service establishment closed by Order of the Department of Health and Mental Hygiene because reason for sewage failure was not corrected. NYCHC 81.20(b)

Food, food preparation area, food storage area or area(s) used by employees or patrons contaminated by sewage or liquid waste in that liquid waste  was observed contaminating kitchen & rear storage area. At the time of inspection liquid waste was backing up from the drain pipe under the steamers & flooding the kitchen & rear storage area. Said liquid waste was flowing constantly for approximately 10 minutes until the house tra unclog to release the liquid waste. Corrective action: Reason for sewage failure was corrected.  Contaminated area was washed, rinsed and sanitized. NYCHC 81.20(b)

Food, food preparation area, food storage area or area(s) used by employees or patrons contaminated by sewage or liquid waste in that sewage from clogged floor drain was observed contaminating basement hallway leading to food/equipment storage room. Putrid smell was observed emanating from water. Workers must pass through flooded area in order to reach supplies in food/equipment storage room. One food worker was observed crossing wooden planks in flooded area at time of inspection. Corrective action: Plumber removed clog in floor drain correcting sewage failure.  Contaminated area was washed, rinsed and sanitized with bleach and water by building plumber. Paper goods and supplies were relocated to 1st floor storage area. All food in food/equipment storage room was voluntarily discarded. NYCHC 81.20(b)

Food, food preparation area, food storage area or area(s) used by employees or patrons contaminated by sewage or liquid waste in that standing liquid waste from the grease trap was observed contaminating the entired basement where food and paper good storage are located. Corrective action: Reason for sewage failure was corrected.  Contaminated area was washed, rinsed and sanitized. NYCHC 81.20(b)

Food found contaminated in that approximately 10 pounds of  ice cubes for customer consumption as per operator  observed to be contaminated by water dripping directly onto said ice from the upper inner panel of ice machine in second flood food/dry goods/equipment storage area.Said upper inner panel was observed rusty and covered with mildew. Corrective action: Operator instructed to contact a licensed plumber to correct the reason for sewage failure and operator must wash, rinse, and sanitize the contaminated area. NYCHC 81.20(b)

Food preparation area, food storage area or other area used by employees or patrons contaminated by sewage or liquid waste in that clear rainwater in the entire basement floor (approximately 3 inch depth) leaking from roof was observed contaminating entire floor. Said area was flooded 20 minutes prior to inspection, as per FPC holder MUSHTAG BALMACOON. Contaminating water observed all over the floor throughout the basement employee's restroom, single service storage area, ice machine, liquor storage room that clearly contaminating the FSE.  Corrective action: Reason for sewage failure was corrected. Operator instructed to get a professional cleaning to wash, rinse, and sanitize the contaminated area. NYCHC 81.20(b)

Food preparation area, food storage area or other area used by employees or patrons contaminated by sewage or liquid waste in that liquid sewage water leaking profusely from the ceiling above the delivery staircase leading to the outside was observed contaminating the food storage area in the basement. liquid waste was observed flooding the floor of the food/paper goods storage area containing single use items for customer use and an assortment of condiments. Walk-in refrigerator is also located in the basement approximately 20 feet away from where the leakage is occurring. Corrective action: Operator closed down the FSE and called a licensed plumber. NYCHC 81.20(b)

Harborage or conditions conducive to rodents, insects or other pests exist in that (1) standing, murky water approximately 4 inches deep was observed flooding the basement floor adjacent to areas where live fruit flies were observed swarming and (2) 2 bags of food waste were observed being stored on the floor and not in tightly covered waste receptacles in the rear of the kitchen where live fruit flies were observed. NYCHC 81.23(a) Please note that the violation you have been issued for having conditions conducive the existence of pests is separate and distinct from the violation you have been issued for having pests and both may be sustained by the Hearings Division. See DOHMH v. Harissa LLC, Dkt 0879213F0, Appeal Decision Oct. 8, 2013 at 1 and DOHMH v. Just Lorraine's Place, LLC Dkt 2748012F1, Appeal Decision Apr. 9, 2013 at 4. available on nyls.edu/cityadmin.

Liquid waste not carried to sewer or sewage disposal system so as to prevent contamination of the premises and its contents in that potable water from water main break from street observed seeping through basement wall in  basement food storage/prep area causing the basement floor to be flooded  . DEP came to assess the issue and served a notice that the water will be shut off from 4pm for 8 hours.  Operating voluntarily closed NYCHC 81.20(b)

Liquid waste not carried to sewer or sewage disposal system so as to prevent contamination of the premises and its contents in that waste water was observed actively draining into and flooding floor of landlord's adjoined area separated by a door from the FSE's storage area & walk-in keg refrigerator . Live roaches present in that 32 live roaches were observed throughout basement kitchen; 2 observed crawling on food storage shelf above food prep table on left side of basement, 2 observed crawling on floor behind two door lowboy refrigerator on left side of basement, 5 observed crawling on wall behind dry food storage shelf on left side of basement, 2 observed crawling on underside of food prep table across from handwash sink on left side of basement, 1 observed crawling on wall near stairs on left side of basement, 5 observed crawling near hole in  floor wall junction near stairs on left side of basement, 1 observed crawling on shelf above two door lowboy refrigerator on left side of basement, 1 observed crawling in hole in wall beneath handwash sink on left side of basement, 2 observed crawling along flood wall junction under wok stove on left side of basement, 6 observed crawling on dry food storage shelf above one door reach down freezer on right side of basement, 2 observed crawl

Mouse activity present in that approximately 130 mouse excreta observed throughout the establishment. Approximately 60 observed on floors at floor/wall junction under front service counter and throughout front service/prep area, approximately 30 observed on floor at floor/wall junction under metal food prep table in kitchen and approximately 40 observed on flood at floor/wall junction under plastic storage table in entryway to kitchen. Corrective action: Operator instructed to implement proper pest control measures by removing harborage conditions, such as standing water, closing all entry ways and holes, storing food in vermin proof containers, eliminating breeding conditions, improve overall sanitary conditions, and provide proper extermination, if necessary.  All contaminated area and equipment are to be washed, rinsed, and sanitized..NYCHC 81.23(a)

Sewage and liquid waste not carried to sewer or sewage disposal system so as to prevent contamination of the premises and its contents in that the handwash sink between wok station and 2 door reach in refrigerator closest to dishwasher observed with indirect drain pipe not long enough to go into floor drain, where waste water observed draining onto the floor below handwash sink in kitchen. Sewage and liquid waste not carried to sewer or sewage disposal system so as to prevent contamination of the premises and its contents in that waste line observed blocked and serverly leaking onto floor  of basement. Sewage disposal system improperly constructed or operated in that raw liquid waste water observed backing up and dripping onto basement floor from indirect drain under three compartment sink (1 compartment used for hand wash) in bar area. Sewage disposal system improperly constructed or operated in that raw sewage observed in food storage area in basement. Said basementis 90% flooded with liquid waste more than 2 to 4-inch deep. Corrective action: Food service establishment closed by Order of the Department of Health and Mental Hygiene because reason for sewage failure was not corrected. NYCHC 81.20(b) and (c )

Sewage disposal system not provided, improper, inadequate or unapproved in that liquid waste was from floor drain was observed backing up cloudy liquid waste with foul odor and flooding basement storage area next to hot water heater. Sewage disposal system not provided, improperly constructed or not operating adequately in that a backup of sewage water was observed rising from the floor drains & onto the tiled floor in the food preparation/service area. Sewage disposal system not provided, improperly constructed or not operating adequately in that grease trap was observed spewing with dirty oil and raw sewage in basement. Sewage disposal system not provided, improperly constructed or not operating adequately in that liquid waste murky water was observed 1.5 feet deep throughout basement food storage area. Sewage disposal system not provided, improperly constructed or not operating adequately in that liquid waste observed overflowing from a wastewater backup in the slop sink and flooding approximately 30% of the floor of the basement storage area with wastewater approximately 1 inch deep. Food, food preparation area, food storage area or area(s) used by employees or patrons contaminated by sewage or liquid in that approximately 1/2 inch of sewage water was observed contaminating basement food storage area and dishwashing area in basement. Food, food preparation area, food storage area or area(s) used by employees or patrons contaminated by sewage or liquid in that stagnant, brown, foul smelling water with feces was observed contaminating the entire basement food storage area. Food, food preparation area, food storage area or area(s) used by employees or patrons contaminated by sewage or liquid waste in that approximately 2 inches of dark murky standing sewage waste water with floating debris, and a pungent odor  was observed contaminating the basement dry goods, canned goods, and  equipment storage area. The food workers have to step through the sewage waste water to access the dry goods, and canned goods storage area in the basement. Contaminated food was rendered inedible and discarded.  Contaminated area was washed, rinsed and sanitized. NYCHC 81.20(b)

Food, food preparation area, food storage area or area(s) used by employees or patrons contaminated by sewage or liquid waste in that murky water (measuring approximately 10 feet in diameter) emitting a foul odor was observed contaminating hookah preparation area. Handwash facility inadequate in that bar handwash sink/3-compartment sink, male and female employee/patron toilet facility handwash sink and a non-used kitchen hand wash sink observed without hot running water, at the time of inspection. Hand washing sink obstructed in or near ground floor kitchen. Sewage and liquid waste not carried to sewer or sewage disposal system so as to prevent contamination of the premises and its contents in that condensate waste line observed leaking directly on to floor leading from ice machine in food storage room behind bar . Said condensate waste line observed draining directly on to concrete floor and then flowing to floor drain, causing flooding in said storage room.  NYCHC 81.21(b)

Sewage disposal system improperly constructed or operated in that raw sewage observed flooding dry storage area in basement noted with paper goods and CO tanks. Sewage contained toilet tissue pieces, feces, and a putrid smell. Basement storage area accessed thru common basement area shared with neighboring establishment, which is also observed contaminated/flooded with sewage. Corrective action: Food service establishment closed by Order of the Department of Health and Mental Hygiene because reason for sewage failure was not corrected. NYCHC 81.20(b) and (c )

Sewage disposal system improperly constructed or operated in that sewege pipe observed leaking causing accumulation of sewage water on basement floor. Basement observed partially flooded. No food storage or paper goods storage observed in basement. Only hot water heater observed in basement. Corrective action: Food service establishment closed by Order of the Department of Health and Mental Hygiene because reason for sewage failure was not corrected. NYCHC 81.21(b)

Sewage disposal system not provided, improper, inadequate or unapproved in that clear rainwater observed stagnant onto floor from roof in the entire basement area. Said area was flooded 20 minutes prior to inspection, as per FPC holder MUSHTAG BALMACOON. Contaminating water observed all over the floor throughout the basement employee's restroom, single service storage area, ice machine, liquor storage room that clearly contaminating the FSE. Corrective action: Operator instructed to contact a licensed plumber to correct the reason for sewage failure. NYCHC 81.20(b)

Sewage disposal system not provided, improperly constructed or not operating adequately in that liquid waste murky water was observed 1.5 feet deep throughout basement food storage area. Said waste water was observed inside walk-in refrigerator where approximately 30 pounds of mozarella cheese, a carton of fresh lettuce, a carton of fresh tomatoes, a 40 pound box of raw chicken wings, two plastic containers with approximately 3 gallons of cooked tomato sauce are all observed stored in said food storage area. Said waste water is observed contacting cases of Snapple beverage in basement food storage area. A wet carton is observed resting on a case of canned pizza sauce. Operator stated the flooding is as a result of the heavy rain and the waste water is coming from the landlord's basement. Corrective action: Awaiting a decision from the DOHMH Office. NYCHC 81.20(b)

Sewage disposal system not provided, improperly constructed or not operating adequately in that liquid waste was observed overflowing from the clogged toilet bowl and flooding the floor inside the employees/patrons restroom in the rear customer seating area. As per operator, said toilet is clogged from customer flushing down paper towels which blocked the waste pipe. Corrective action: Reason for sewage failure was corrected. Operator unclogged the toilet, at the time of the inspection. NYCHC 81.20(b)

Sewage/liquid waste not carried to sewer or sewage disposal system in that waste observed contaminating basement food prep area. Cooked ready to eat chicken was observed uncovered in said area. In order to access 2-compartment sink, hand washing sink cooked rice and cooked chicken food worker must walk through sewage water to access said foods. Entire basement was observed flooded in approximately 1 foot of sewage water. To enter employee rest room food worker must walk into said water. Brown particles were observed floating in said water. . Corrective action: All food was removed from the area.  Contaminated food was rendered inedible and discarded.  Contaminated area was washed, rinsed and sanitized. NYCHC 81.21(b)

Sewage/liquid waste not carried to sewer or sewage disposal system in that waste observed contaminating the food storage area in the basement. Food storage noted with 1-door reach down freezer (filled with frozen food) soda syrup boxes, soda bottles and dry paper goods in the basement. Slop sink noted clogged with liquid waste spilling onto the floor, flooding the whole entire basement. Corrective action: All food was removed from the area.  Contaminated food was rendered inedible and discarded.  Contaminated area was washed, rinsed and sanitized. NYCHC 81.21(b)

Sewage/liquid waste not carried to sewer or sewage disposal system in that waste observed contaminating walk-in refrigerator and keg/beverage storage area in basement. Said area (approximately 10 feet by 15 feet storage room) observed flooded by approxiamtely 2 inches deep of stagnant waste water above cement floor. Said waste water was observed inside walk-in refrigerator and adjacent areas (beverage storage room).. Corrective action: Food service establishment closed by Order of the Department of Health and Mental Hygiene because reason for sewage failure was not corrected. NYCHC 81.20(b)

Filth Flies or food/refuse/sewage flies present in that approximately 8 live house flies observed flying around near flooding floor drain in the basement.
